page.title: 09LOCAL MILK FIRM
page.content: The{Dairy Crest}depot next door to Browick First School, has occupied the 70 year old building for the past 4 years. Twelve thousand pints of milk arrive daily from Norwich Milk Marketing Board and are dealt with by six supervisory staff which includes a Manager. The bottles are stored overnight in the largest cold store, at a temperature of 44 degrees F. Returned bottles are stored in a second container and the third accomodates other dairy products like butter, cream, yoghurt and fruit juice. Fifteen milkmen start their rounds from 4 a.m. and make deliveries of up to 40 miles each day by electric or petrol driven floats. A variety of different types of milk is sold, costing from 22p to 26p per pint.
